column3:
desc
(Parameter description)
column4:
get
(Command for querying parameter values.)
column8:
options
(For the discrete type, use";"to split  different values.)
column9:
dtype
(For discrete, the parameter value type can only be int or string.)
column13:
items
(Enumerated values out of parameter values. Use ";" to split different values)

column3: Maximum number of threads requested by the customer
column4: server_xml_dir=/home/atune_5555/apache-tomcat-10.0.23/conf/server.xml && begin_line=$(sed -n '/<Connector/=' $server_xml_dir | head -n 1) && end_line=$(sed -n "$begin_line,/maxThreads/=" $server_xml_dir | tail -n 1) && (sed -n "${end_line}p" $server_xml_dir | cut -d '=' -f 2) | cut -d '"' -f 2

column3: Number of Socket threads created during Tomcat initialization
column4: server_xml_dir=/home/atune_5555/apache-tomcat-10.0.23/conf/server.xml && begin_line=$(sed -n '/<Connector/=' $server_xml_dir | head -n 1) && end_line=$(sed -n "$begin_line,/minSpareThreads/=" $server_xml_dir | tail -n 1) && (sed -n "${end_line}p" $server_xml_dir | cut -d '=' -f 2) | cut -d '"' -f 2

column3: Releases the cache. The cache is released each time the parameter is modified.
column4: sysctl -n vm.drop_caches

column3:
The value 1 indicates that TIME-WAIT sockets can be used for new TCP connections,
      and the value 0 indicates that TIME-WAIT sockets are disabled.
column4: sysctl -n net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse

column3: Maximum duration for a socket to remain in the FIN_WAIT_2 state.
column4: sysctl -n net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout

column3:
Reduce the number of TIME_WAIT connections to prevent excessive TIME_WAIT
      connections from occupying network resources and increasing the latency. The
      default value is 2048. You are advised to change the value to 360000.
column4: sysctl -n net.ipv4.tcp_max_tw_buckets

column3:
The range of available ports has been increased to prevent performance deterioration
      caused by continuous search of available ports for new connections when a large
      number of connections occupy ports.
column4: sysctl -n net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range

column3:
Defines the maximum length of the listening queue of each port in the system.
      This is a global parameter. The default value is 128. You are advised to change
      the value to 1024.
column4: sysctl -n net.core.somaxconn

column3:
Indicates the length of the SYN queue. A larger queue length can accommodate
      more network connections waiting for connections. The default value is 2048.
      You are advised to change the value to 8192.
column4: sysctl -n net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog

column3:
Maximum system socket read buffer The default value is 229376. You are advised
      to change the value to 16777216.
column4: sysctl -n net.core.rmem_max

column3:
The maximum size of the system socket write buffer is increased to prevent
      buffer overflow caused by a large number of new connections. As a result, connections
      cannot be established. The default value is 229376. You are advised to change
      the value to 16777216.
column4: sysctl -n net.core.wmem_max

column3: Maximum number of files that can be used by a user.
column4: ulimit -n
